text.p: Here are highlights of stories in Romania's press on Monday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy:
Business:
BURSA
- A decision on privatising the Bacau-based Rafo oil refinery will be made next month, the newspaper says.

- Wheat has been harvested only on 42 percent of the planted area, down from estimates that the whole wheat crop would be taken in by end July, the newspaper quotes a farming ministry survey as showing.
ADEVARUL

- Finance Minister Mircea Ciumara submitted a first draft of the planned budget revision to a cabinet meeting on Friday, the newspaper says. The government is expected to discuss the revised budget at a meeting on Monday.
- Starting in September, telephone charges will undergo quarterly adjustments for inflation, the newspaper quotes a communications ministry official as saying.
- Rain and chronic shortages of combine harvesters, delayed wheat harvesting, the newspaper says.
EVENIMENTUL ZILEI
- Romania's Petrom oil authority wants to use the commodities exchange to trade domestically-produced oil, the newspaper says.
ROMANIA LIBERA
- Andrei Dimitriu, chairman of the Romanian Development Agency, says in an interview that Romania's plans to draw in foreign investments would be jeopardised if the agency were scrapped.
- A German bank branch will soon open in the Transylvanian city of Sibiu, the newspaper says.
General:
- ADEVARUL
- Cluj police identified three workers employed by local public utilities as the persons who removed the flag from the Hungarian consulate in the city, the newspaper says.
- Romania has turned into a conduit for illegal immigrants, says a newspaper report.

- The northeast city of Iasi is hosting the first pan-European meeting of Non-Smokers held in an East European ex-Communist country. Iasi has been picked up because its mayor has banned smoking in all public buildings, the newspaper says.
- With a delay of one year and a half, the scaffolding on the Hotel Athenee Palace, taken over by Hilton, comes down today.
EVENIMENTUL ZILEI
- After Poland and the Czech Republic, floods also threaten Romania, the newspaper says, reporting that 1,000 hectares have been flooded in the western Arad county.
ROMANIA LIBERA

- Romanian truckers' STAR labour federation will stage protests in Bucharest Wednesday. The protesters plan to drive their trucks, horns blaring, across the capital from 9 a.m. to 1 p.m. to protest against a new road tax.
-- Bucharest Newsroom, 40-1 3120264
